scenarios.question: You see a plastic bottle on the ground. What do you do?

options.text: Pick it up and put it in the recycling bin
options.feedback: Great job! Recycling helps keep our planet clean!

options.text: Leave it there
options.feedback: Plastic takes hundreds of years to decompose. Let's recycle it!

scenarios.question: You're brushing your teeth. What should you do with the water?

options.text: Turn off the tap while brushing
options.feedback: Awesome! You can save up to 8 gallons of water per day!

options.text: Keep the water running
options.feedback: Turning off the tap saves precious water. Every drop counts!

scenarios.question: Your family is going to the grocery store. How should you carry items?

options.text: Bring reusable bags from home
options.feedback: Perfect! Reusable bags reduce plastic waste significantly!

options.text: Use new plastic bags each time
options.feedback: Plastic bags harm wildlife and pollute oceans. Reusable bags are better!

scenarios.question: You're leaving a room. What should you do with the lights?

options.text: Turn them off
options.feedback: Excellent! Saving electricity helps reduce pollution!

options.text: Leave them on
options.feedback: Turning off lights saves energy and helps the environment!

scenarios.question: You want to plant something in your garden. What's the best choice?

options.text: Plant a tree that provides fruit and shade
options.feedback: Amazing! Trees clean the air and provide food for animals!

options.text: Just keep the grass
options.feedback: Trees are super important! They give us oxygen and help cool the planet!

scenarios.question: You have old clothes that don't fit. What should you do?

options.text: Donate them or give to someone who needs them
options.feedback: Wonderful! Reusing clothes reduces waste and helps others!

options.text: Throw them in the trash
options.feedback: Donating clothes helps people and reduces landfill waste!

scenarios.question: You see someone littering in the park. What do you do?

options.text: Politely remind them about keeping the park clean
options.feedback: You're an Eco Hero! Spreading awareness helps everyone!

options.text: Ignore it
options.feedback: Speaking up kindly can inspire others to care for our planet!

scenarios.question: Your school is organizing a cleanup drive. What do you do?

options.text: Join and encourage friends to participate
options.feedback: Incredible! Community action creates real change!

options.text: Skip it and play games instead
options.feedback: Working together makes our community cleaner and healthier!

scenarios.question: You're buying a new water bottle. Which one is best for the environment?

options.text: A reusable stainless steel bottle
options.feedback: Perfect choice! One reusable bottle can replace thousands of plastic ones!

options.text: Keep buying disposable plastic bottles
options.feedback: Reusable bottles save money and protect our oceans!

scenarios.question: You want to learn more about climate change. What do you do?

options.text: Research and share what you learn with others
options.feedback: You're a true Eco Hero! Knowledge is power for change!

options.text: Think it's too complicated to understand
options.feedback: Learning about our planet helps us protect it better!
